title: The Wild Wood
description: A young artist returns to her cabin in the deep woods of Canada to concentrate on her illustrations. But somehow, strange and beautiful creatures are slipping into her drawings and sketches. The world of Faerie is reaching out to her for help--and she may be its last chance for survival."What makes de Lint's particular brand of fantasy so catchy is his attention to the ordinary. Like great writers of magic realism, he writes about people in the world we know, encountering magic as part of that world."-- BooklistRead the other books in Brian Froud's Faerielands series, each one inspired by a piece of the famous artist's Something Rich and Strange by Patricia A. McKillipThe Wood Wife by Terri WindlingHannah's Garden by Midori Snyder
author: Charles de Lint
